Posts.Content: Edgerider, Thanks so much for the information. Any thoughts on the efficacy of switching from Ibrance to Verzenio due to mild progression? Know they are same class of drugs. Worth trying a switch or no? Thoughts? Thanks, Waldbet
Posts.Title: Verzenio minimum effective dose

Posts.Content: Edgerider, Thanks so much again for all the information. I wonder if my minor progression with new small spinal lesion on Ibrance (combined with Letrozole) is due to Rebound G1/S Activation which builds during my Ibrance off week. I don’t think we will ever know for sure but regardless, after 2 1/2 years on Ibrance and now with slight progression in spine, I have decided to give Verzenio a try in combination with Letrozole. I know the next big change is to Faslodex but I would like to prolong my time on a CDK4/6 inhibitor as long as possible. So far my mets is widespread to bone but no where else. Wish me luck :) Again, thank you for your vast knowledge and time. Greatly appreciated!!!
Posts.Title: Verzenio minimum effective dose

Posts.Content: Thank you all very much!! That article was very interesting. May be worth a 28 day Ibrance holiday and then restarting Ibrance or newly starting Verzenio. I will, of course, discuss these options with my onc. Just feeling like it may be time to try something new and not necessarily be bound to evidenced based care due to lack of available data of newer options. Seems to me I don’t have much to lose as the cancer metastisized anyway even with the recommended treatment. Feeling empowered to make treatment decisions that may be slightly unorthodox but certainly not foolhardy or contraindicated as I really want to live!!
Posts.Title: Switching to Verzenio after Ibrance

Posts.Content: Hi All, After 30 months on Ibrance I now have new mild progression on my spine. After doing some reading I am changing my Ibrance schedule (with my onc’s consent) to 5 days on and 2 days off for the whole month rather than the usual 21 days on and 7 days off. I know there is no research to support this but I am wondering if a more steady dose of Ibrance with just 2 days off at a time rather than the entire week off will halt the progression. My calculations indicate that 5 days on and 2 days off delivers approximately the same amount as 21 days on and 7 days off. And perhaps the new schedule will keep my counts up and my cancer growth down. Has anyone else done this or had any experience with changing the recommended Ibrance schedule? Thanks so much!
Posts.Title: Ibrance schedule variation

Posts.Content: Hi All, Has anyone out there started Verzenio on the LOWEST dose rather than starting with the HIGHEST dose? I am starting Verzenio next month after progression on Ibrance. I will remain on Letrozole and would be switching from Ibrance to Verzenio. I was only able to tolerate Ibrance at 75mg after starting at 125mg and decreasing to 100mg and then to 75mg. I am wondering if starting on the LOWEST dose of Verzenio would help me deal with the SE’s of low blood counts, diarrhea and nausea. My Onc is open to my considerations. I am more interested in minimum effective dose than maximum tolerated dose. Anyone have any experiences or thoughts to share? All the Verzenio SE’s are scaring me!! Overall I tolerated 75mg of Ibrance pretty well but now have new lesion on spine and others larger. Time for a change... Thanks!
Posts.Title: Verzenio minimum effective dose

Posts.Content: Just wondering- how was the month in relation to SE’s. Bad stomach issues or no? Good luck with your labs! Thanks!
Posts.Title: Verzenio minimum effective dose

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your response. Were you on Ibrance before this or is Verzenio your first drug in this class?

Posts.Content: Annem50, Thanks for the info. Good luck to both of us with Verzenio! I was wondering- if the Verzenio does not agree with you, meaning too many adverse side effects, would you be able to go back on Ibrance since it sounds like you did so well on that? Are people able to go back and forth between Ibrance and Verzenio? For example 2 years on Ibrance- then Verzenio for 1 year- then back on Ibrance? Just to mix things up with known and unknown side effects?
Posts.Title: Verzenio minimum effective dose

Posts.Content: Did you have any SE’s on 50mg of Verzenio? Sounds like you are tolerating it very well which is great to hear! Thanks.
Posts.Title: Verzenio minimum effective dose

Posts.Content: Hi All, I have been on Ibrance and Letrozole since Sept, 2016 for my ER+ MBC. New scans show mild progression with new lesions on spine. My onc suggested not changing medications for now and continuing to monitor the situation. When time comes, probably in a few months, onc recommends switching to Ibrance and Faslodex. But I am considering changing to VERZENIO with Letrozole just to see if it shakes things up a bit and gives the cancer something new to contend with. My onc indicates this is not contraindicated but not his first choice either as there is no data to support this. Has anyone out there switched from Ibrance to Verzenio after having progression on Ibrance? Was it effective? Side effects? Thoughts? Thanks so much!!
Posts.Title: Switching to Verzenio after Ibrance

Posts.Content: Josiegirl, How did your PET and labs turn out? I have been thinking of you!
